alert.note: Alert for Northern Fairfield; Northern Middlesex; Northern New Haven; Northern New London; Southern Middlesex; Southern New Haven (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 01 at 7:30PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...SHOWERS AND ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS WITH GUSTS WINDS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHWESTERN NEW LONDON, CENTRAL FAIRFIELD, MIDDLESEX AND NEW HAVEN COUNTIES THROUGH 815 PM EDT... At 728 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a line of showers and isolated thunderstorms along a line extending from Bristol to near Monroe to near Trumbull. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Wolcott and Woodbridge around 735 PM EDT. Bethany around 740 PM EDT. Hamden around 745 PM EDT. Meriden and Middletown around 750 PM EDT. New Haven and Orange around 755 PM EDT. North Haven and Cromwell around 800 PM EDT. East Hampton, Durham, North Branford and Portland around 805 PM EDT. Guilford and Branford around 810 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include East Haven, Moodus, Madison, Higganum, West Haven, Oxford, Ansonia and Deep River. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 10 PM. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH

area.areaDesc: Northern Fairfield; Northern Middlesex; Northern New Haven; Northern New London; Southern Middlesex; Southern New Haven
